newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai soybean futures end mixed on uncertainty.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai soybean futures end mixed on uncertainty.

text.p: Shanghai soybean futures ended mixed in dull trading on Wednesday, with the short-term market trend unclear, traders said.
The key January 1997 contract ended at an intra-day high of 3,205 yuan ($386) per tonne, rising three yuan. It opened at a low of 3,180.
March fell 29 to 3,215, May 18 to 3,310, July 20 to 3,350, September rose 30 to 3,380 and November was unchanged at 3,400.
Combined volume fell to 10,900 tonnes from 11,150.
Traders said most investors remained on the sidelines due to gloomy market sentiment, with the short-term trend unclear.
"Despite poor fundamentals, few investors wanted to build a a large volume of short positions before the short-term market trend becomes clearer," one trader said.
Traders expect soybean to move around 3,200 yuan in the next few days.
